items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels at Sherborne Lake continue to fall.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  Generally dry conditions are forecast for the next five days, with the chance of an isolated shower.
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are clearing debris from weed screens.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

River levels remain high but are continuing to fall at the Brokenborough river gauge as a result of the recent rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible until later tomorrow, 28/05/2021.  We believe there is a possibility of flooding for the road at Reybridge.   
No further rainfall is forecast.  River levels are falling, but still pose a flood risk.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated by 10:00 on Friday, 28/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Shropshire, Staffordshire, Telford and Wrekin, Wrexham

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.    No further rainfall is forecast.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are falling on the River Thame and Chalgrove Brook after responding to heavy rainfall earlier in the week. Levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold but standing water may remain.
Today, (27/05/2021) and overnight are forecast to be mainly dry. We expect river levels to continue to fall throughout the catchment. Our incident response staff are monitoring the situation closely. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings. 
This message will be updated this evening, 27/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Severn estuary from Gloucester to Sharpness
items.message: A tidal surge in union with elevated river levels are expected to affect the foreshore. Flooding to roads and farmland is possible at these times, however conditions may apply two to four hours either side of the high tide. Predicted next tide peak:- 2.9m to 3.2m at 11:00am Thursday 27 May. Thresholds at other gauge locations are not expected to be crossed. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by midday 27 May 2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond will be 4.86 mAOD at 03:45 on 27/05/2021 and 4.72 mAOD at 16:15 on 27/05/2021.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is normal for this time of year at 135 cubic metres per second and is falling slowly. We anticipate the flows to remain normal for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 19:00 on 27/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
Coastal conditions are easing with reduced wind speeds and the passing of spring tides.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please be careful along beaches, promenades and coastal footpaths and roads.

Property flooding is not currently expected. High tide is expected at Trowlock Island at 4:15am tomorrow morning. The river may overtop banks and flood low lying land. The tide is forecast to reach 4.92 - 4.98 metres. The next high tide is not forecast to overtop banks and flood low lying land.
 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid contact with flood water and avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 27/05/21.
